meanings.sent1: I need to redeposit the money in the bank.
meanings.sent2: After withdrawing cash, I always redeposit it into my savings account.
meanings.sent3: Oops, I forgot to redeposit the coins back into the piggy bank!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness redeposited hope into my heart.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully redeposited the seeds into the soil.

meanings.definition: To place money back into an account.
meanings.sent1: Please redeposit the check into your checking account.
meanings.sent2: I always redeposit any extra cash I have at the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: He had to redeposit the money after accidentally withdrawing it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile redeposited joy into his life.
meanings.sent5: The student quickly redeposited the borrowed money into his friend's wallet.

meanings.definition: To put something back in its original place.
meanings.sent1: Don't forget to redeposit the book on the shelf after reading it.
meanings.sent2: She always redeposits her tools in the toolbox after using them.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loves to redeposit the toys all over the house.
meanings.sent4: The wind redeposited the fallen leaves back onto the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The librarian carefully redeposited the misplaced book on the correct shelf.
